name: Pope St. Marcellus I
summary: Marcellus I was the Bishop of Rome from 308 to 309, during a brief lull in the Diocletian persecution. He is known for his strict discipline regarding those who had lapsed during the persecution, requiring public penance before readmission to the Church. According to tradition, he was martyred for his faith. He is venerated as a saint and is often depicted with a donkey, symbolizing his work in caring for the Church.
